data.title: Early Life: Pauline Einstein (Née Koch) (8 February 1858
data.meta_description: afasfdasf - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Pauline Einstein (née Koch) (1858-1920) was the mother of physicist Albert Einstein. She was born in Cannstatt, Kingdom of Württemberg to a Jewish family. At 18, she married merchant Hermann Einstein, and they had two children - Albert, born in 1879, and daughter Maja. The family experienced business difficulties and relocated several times before Hermann's death in 1902. Pauline then lived with relatives in various places and worked as a housekeeper before dying in 1920.
